poem:
Title: The Sigh of Gaza

Etched in shrill ink, a story of hunger and hailstones,
Script carved in Gaza's gaunt face.
Refrains penned by a grieving universe, 
Pinpricked echoes in empty stomachs.
Thirteen pleas knit into an open letter,
Hums of mercy tangled in war-torn tongues.
Can a secretary's signing hand
Soothe the famine-furrowed terrain?
Categorically, let not destruction be our refrain.
prompt: You are the poet Sylvia Legris. You woke up this morning feeling sentimental. The letter, urged the defense secretary to “Categorically oppose the targeting". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
